solution_line_template: On the first day, the library used {students_day1} students * {books_per_student} books = <<{students_day1}*{books_per_student}={books_used_day1}>>{books_used_day1} books.
On the second day, the library used {students_day2} students * {books_per_student} books = <<{students_day2}*{books_per_student}={books_used_day2}>>{books_used_day2} books.
On the third day, the library used {students_day3} students * {books_per_student} books = <<{students_day3}*{books_per_student}={books_used_day3}>>{books_used_day3} books.

On the fourth day, the library had {initial_total_books} books - {books_used_day1} - {books_used_day2} - {books_used_day3} = <<{initial_total_books}-{books_used_day1}-{books_used_day2}-{books_used_day3}={books_remaining_day4}>>{books_remaining_day4} books remaining.

The library can help {books_remaining_day4} books / {books_per_student} books = <<{books_remaining_day4}/{books_per_student}={students_can_be_helped_day4}>>{students_can_be_helped_day4} students on the fourth day.
